desc: A group of people living together in an organized way.
example: Education plays a key role in modern society.

desc: Activities related to governing or influencing government policy.
example: He is very interested in politics and current affairs.

desc: The group of people with authority to govern a country.
example: The government introduced a new law last week.

desc: A system of rules created and enforced through social or governmental institutions.
Legal or moral entitlements to have or do something.
example: Human rights are protected by international law.

desc: A system of government by the whole population, usually through elected representatives.
example: In a democracy, citizens vote for their leaders.

desc: Processes in which people vote to choose leaders or decide issues.
example: Presidential elections are held every four years.

desc: A political organization with specific beliefs and goals.
example: She is a member of a liberal party.

desc: An elected representative in a legislative body.
example: The deputy presented the bill to parliament.

desc: The highest legislative authority in a country.
example: The law was debated in parliament.
